title: Conda package built from master branch segfaults when using CUDA
body_html:
I am trying to create a conda package for the master branch of PyTorch.

I am able to build the package which runs fine in CPU mode. However, when I try to use any CUDA operations, I instantly get a segfault. I think the problem is that the compiled binaries look for header files in a different location then where they are installed (e.g. /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522090391878/work/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen/Context.h instead of /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/include/ATen/Context.h). However, I am not sure how I can fix this?

The conda recipe is available here: https://gitlab.com/ostrokach-forge/pytorch.
The build log is available here: https://gitlab.com/ostrokach-forge/pytorch/-/jobs/59574148.

During the build, conda gives the following warning, which I think is related:

Warning: rpath /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522100556264/work/torch/lib/tmp_install/lib is outside prefix /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522100556264/_h_env_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_place (removing it)

I tried importing the resulting package in GDB with the following output:

(gdb) r -c "import torch; print(torch.eye(10, 10).cuda())"
Starting program: /home/username/anaconda3/bin/python -c "import torch; print(torch.eye(10, 10).cuda())"
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".
[New Thread 0x7ffff2cae700 (LWP 27480)]
[New Thread 0x7ffff24ad700 (LWP 27481)]
[New Thread 0x7fffedcac700 (LWP 27482)]
[New Thread 0x7fffeb4ab700 (LWP 27483)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe8caa700 (LWP 27484)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe64a9700 (LWP 27485)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe3ca8700 (LWP 27486)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe34a7700 (LWP 27487)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe2ca6700 (LWP 27488)]
[New Thread 0x7fffde4a5700 (LWP 27489)]
[New Thread 0x7fffdbca4700 (LWP 27490)]
[Thread 0x7fffdbca4700 (LWP 27490) exited]
[Thread 0x7fffde4a5700 (LWP 27489) exited]
[Thread 0x7fffe2ca6700 (LWP 27488) exited]

Thread 1 "python" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007fffd19b4337 in at::Context::lazyInitCUDA()::{lambda()#1}::operator()() const (__closure=<optimized out>) at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522090391878/work/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen/Context.h:53
53      /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522090391878/work/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen/Context.h: No such file or directory.

ldd gives the following output:

linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007ffc5c154000)

The system parameters are as follows:

  • OS: Centos 6 / Ubuntu 16.04
  • PyTorch version: master (1ab248d09e256944d41c3099ef0fcfb8ab844523)
  • Python version: Anaconda Python 3.6.4
  • CUDA: 8.0
  • GPU: P100
  • GCC: 4.8 (from devtoolset-2-toolchain)
body_text:
I am trying to create a conda package for the master branch of PyTorch.
I am able to build the package which runs fine in CPU mode. However, when I try to use any CUDA operations, I instantly get a segfault. I think the problem is that the compiled binaries look for header files in a different location then where they are installed (e.g. /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522090391878/work/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen/Context.h instead of /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/include/ATen/Context.h). However, I am not sure how I can fix this?
The conda recipe is available here: https://gitlab.com/ostrokach-forge/pytorch.
The build log is available here: https://gitlab.com/ostrokach-forge/pytorch/-/jobs/59574148.
During the build, conda gives the following warning, which I think is related:
Warning: rpath /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522100556264/work/torch/lib/tmp_install/lib is outside prefix /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522100556264/_h_env_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_place (removing it)

body:
I am trying to create a conda package for the master branch of PyTorch.

I am able to build the package which runs fine in CPU mode. However, when I try to use any CUDA operations, I instantly get a segfault. I think the problem is that the compiled binaries look for header files in a different location then where they are installed (e.g. `/opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522090391878/work/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen/Context.h` instead of `/home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/include/ATen/Context.h`). However, I am not sure how I can fix this?

The conda recipe is available here: https://gitlab.com/ostrokach-forge/pytorch.
The build log is available here: https://gitlab.com/ostrokach-forge/pytorch/-/jobs/59574148.

During the build, conda gives the following warning, which I think is related:

```raw
Warning: rpath /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522100556264/work/torch/lib/tmp_install/lib is outside prefix /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522100556264/_h_env_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_placehold_place (removing it)
```

I tried importing the resulting package in GDB with the following output:

```raw
(gdb) r -c "import torch; print(torch.eye(10, 10).cuda())"
Starting program: /home/username/anaconda3/bin/python -c "import torch; print(torch.eye(10, 10).cuda())"
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".
[New Thread 0x7ffff2cae700 (LWP 27480)]
[New Thread 0x7ffff24ad700 (LWP 27481)]
[New Thread 0x7fffedcac700 (LWP 27482)]
[New Thread 0x7fffeb4ab700 (LWP 27483)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe8caa700 (LWP 27484)]
[New Thread 0x7fffe64a9700 (LWP 27485)]

[New Thread 0x7fffde4a5700 (LWP 27489)]
[New Thread 0x7fffdbca4700 (LWP 27490)]
[Thread 0x7fffdbca4700 (LWP 27490) exited]
[Thread 0x7fffde4a5700 (LWP 27489) exited]
[Thread 0x7fffe2ca6700 (LWP 27488) exited]
[Thread 0x7fffe34a7700 (LWP 27487) exited]
[Thread 0x7fffe3ca8700 (LWP 27486) exited]

[Thread 0x7fffedcac700 (LWP 27482) exited]
[Thread 0x7ffff24ad700 (LWP 27481) exited]
[Thread 0x7ffff2cae700 (LWP 27480) exited]

Thread 1 "python" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007fffd19b4337 in at::Context::lazyInitCUDA()::{lambda()#1}::operator()() const (__closure=<optimized out>) at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522090391878/work/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen/Context.h:53
53      /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1522090391878/work/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen/Context.h: No such file or directory.
```

`ldd` gives the following output:

```raw
ldd ~/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so 
linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007ffc5c154000)
libshm.so => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libshm.so (0x00007f3280e06000)

libnvToolsExt.so.1 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/../../../libnvToolsExt.so.1 (0x00007f3280993000)
libpython3.6m.so.1.0 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/../../../libpython3.6m.so.1.0 (0x00007f328044e000)
libATen.so.1 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libATen.so.1 (0x00007f326ef63000)
libnccl.so.1 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libnccl.so.1 (0x00007f326e30c000)
libgcc_s.so.1 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/../../../libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007f326e0fa000)
libpthread.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007f326dec0000)
libc.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6 (0x00007f326daf5000)
/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x0000557e31b5e000)
librt.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1 (0x00007f326d8ed000)
libm.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libm.so.6 (0x00007f326d5e3000)
libdl.so.2 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdl.so.2 (0x00007f326d3df000)
libstdc++.so.6 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/../../.././libstdc++.so.6 (0x00007f326d0a5000)
libutil.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libutil.so.1 (0x00007f326cea1000)

libmkl_gnu_thread.so => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/../../../../libmkl_gnu_thread.so (0x00007f326b023000)

libcusparse.so.8.0 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/../../../../libcusparse.so.8.0 (0x00007f32667bf000)
libcurand.so.8.0 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/../../../../libcurand.so.8.0 (0x00007f3262847000)
libcublas.so.8.0 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/../../../../libcublas.so.8.0 (0x00007f325f7ff000)
libcufft.so.8.0 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/../../../../libcufft.so.8.0 (0x00007f32569ae000)
libgomp.so.1 => /home/username/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/../../../../libgomp.so.1 (0x00007f325678a000
```

The system parameters are as follows:

- OS: Centos 6 / Ubuntu 16.04
- PyTorch version: master (`1ab248d09e256944d41c3099ef0fcfb8ab844523`)
- Python version: Anaconda Python 3.6.4
- CUDA: 8.0
- GPU: P100
- GCC: 4.8 (from `devtoolset-2-toolchain`)
